page.title: 01CUSTOMS
page.content:
{CUSTOMS}
Unlike the other Parishes,Torteval and Forest have relatively little folklore.The parishes were,until recently,remote and densely wooded.There is only one surviving menhir which forms part of a wall at the junction between the Forest and Petit Bot roads. The Perron Du Roi was moved across the road to its present site in 1828.At one time it had been a boundary marker.Later it became a perron or mounting-block used by horseman.This stone is four feet seven inches high and one foot six inches wide at the base.It is eight inches wide at the top.On its north-western corner are three cupmarks,the largest being three inches in diameter and three quarters of an inch deep.
